intro: Constantia cipoensis, commonly known as the Cipoensis constantia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and sandy soils, often in mountainous regions. It produces yellow flowers with a prominent central disk, and its leaves are narrow and grass-like. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
